name: Grotto Bay Beach Resort

reviews.text: Was not overly keen on the hotel or rooms. They were a bit tired and dark. Ours had a view of the bay but the balcony was too small to sit out there comfortably especially with the air con unit right next to you! Food was okay and the steps were manageable. What I am loathe to share is the secret fabulous snorkelling right off the hotel beach. I have snorkelled on the Great Barrier Reef and this is much better. We saw the most amazing array of fish and big ones too. With that and the underwater caves you could swim in, it makes this hotel one in a million.
reviews.title: Brilliant Snorkelling

reviews.text: We spent the last week of July at the Grotto Bay resort - it's pretty, but that's about all it has going for it. We did not get the all inclusive package because we knew we would be doing a lot of touring and wanted to try different restaurants. The meals we did have at Grotto Bay were o.k. - bland and boring. The front desk staff at Grotto Bay is not particularly friendly or helpful (you feel as if you are imposing when you ask a question.) If you want to feel part of Bermuda, make the acquaintance of one of the bell captains outside, the gift shop hostess or the concierges who gave out tour information. The best part of Grotto Bay was Laurette, a concierge who also moonlighted as a singer in the bar. The rooms are o.k. - the U.S. equivalent would be a 1950's hotel - but they are clean. Would I visit Bermuda again? - no, a week is too long. Would I spend my money to stay again at the Grotto Bay? never. Grotto Bay looks pretty, but it is like a shell - pretty on the outside and no substance inside.
reviews.title: boring Bermuda
Honeymoon in Bermuda
reviews.text: We spent 5 days at Grotto Bay. We had a very nice time as Bermuda is a beautiful country and we just wanted to relax and enjoy it. The hotel was nice and clean and not far from the airport. The beach was small but was never overly crowed when we were there. The food was a bit plan, not bad but nothing to write home about either. I will say that we had an all inclusive package which it the way to go because food is so expensive, and the mixed drinks were great, which helped make up for the plan food. There is not a lot to do at night but enjoy the views but that is what we came there for so we were ok with it. The staff was never mean and was nice enough but I would not consider them friendly. There are really neat caves right on the resort that you can take a swin in and that was a highlight for me. Overall we had a great time on our honeymoon and did not have any complaints as the hotel was nice and provided for our needs but I can not say that they were exceptionally friendly or that anything really stood out that would make it better than another hotel.

reviews.title: Very, very nice!!!
reviews.text: Stayed here 1 week - didn't want to leave. Didn't see any "bugs" out of the ordinary. Staff is very friendly. Had all inclusive plan and loved the food, the sightseeing, the drinks - everything. Beach is small, but not overcrowded. Rooms are clean and updated. My wife's a clean freak and she was impressed. Made friends with others who visited and with staff members. Would recomenend this for anyone.

reviews.title: Great Grotto
reviews.text: Just returned from a five day stay at the Grotto Beach Resort - it was absolutely fantastic. The rooms were clean and well-appointed with spectacular views of Bailey's Bay. You also have a view of the airport, but do not hear the planes taking off or landing. The grounds are very tropical looking and in very good condition. Yes, there are steps from the beach to the main building and rooms, but they are more than manageable. The pool area and beach is also very nice. We had low tides throughout our stay thus there was plenty of beach; the water is simply spectacular. The staff was absolutely wonderful, friendly and helpful. Breakfast was also good although a little pricey; we did not have lunch or dinner so can't comment on that. Alot of people were in the all-inclusive which appeared to be a good deal, as all drinks are included.

we just returned , may 29- june 2. we had a great time. no bugs, yes steps but not that bad. small beach, not enough umbrellas. but, the food was great , the people there [workers and guests] were very friendly. all inclusive is the way to go. because everything is way , way, expensive on the island. the water is beautiful, kayacking is great fun and everything there is just so restful. we have been to bermuda four times , three cruises , but, from now on when we go it will be grotto bay.
reviews.title: can't wait to go back

reviews.text: We just got back from a good stay at this resort. We have travelled to Bermuda before and stayed at the luxurious Princess South Hampton, but this was by far a much more relaxed and easy stay. The easy access to the beach was appreciated by our son. The great on resort activities were great for young children. We could feed the fish, look at the caves, take long walks and not get bored with a child. The children's program starts at the end of June and runs through Labor Day so keep that in mind.
reviews.title: Genuinely Decent Stay by Family with 5 year old...

reviews.text: Yes, the walking was a bit much, but it was fun and exercise. Yes, location on the resort does matter. We had an Ocean Front Second floor room. We actually had two rooms that attached because my husband was wise enough to get a room for our son. Thanks hubby. We heard no noise, but while walking near the swingset we did notice machine sounds. We NEVER had airplane noise.
reviews.title: Bermuda Calm

reviews.text: The food was good. We ate there, the Swizzle Inn and at the Pickled Onion. The Pickled Onion is a must see and eat.
reviews.title: Grotto is a good place to pay?
Happy that I didn't believe all the Negative Comments
reviews.text: We were concerned about bugs so we brought ant spray as a preventative measure and we had no problem...there were ants in the hallway. No other insect problems.

Yesterday just returned from Grotto Bay and had a wonderful time. The room was big enaugh, the weather was great. The annual New Year’s Eve Celebration in St. George’s on King's Square was wonderful. Festivities include live band performances, a fireworks display and the lowering of the Bermuda onion. It was free and it was fun!
reviews.title: Great New Year
The worst experience of our lives!
reviews.text: This hotel was terrible. This was booked through Apple Vacations-- which was terrible beyond belief. First, the travel agent, Lake Shore Travel, made us pay for a flight that went from Chicago to Newark, NJ to JFK in New York City to Bermuda-- without telling us! We thought we paid for a flight from Chicago to Newark, NJ to Bermuda. When we picked up the tickets, we found out that wa not the case. But there was noone there to change it for us, because it was during the holidays. We had to pay $120 to take a taxi from Newark to New York City. Then, American Airlines lost our luggage and for four days, my girlfriend, had no clothes. She wore my (her boyfriends' clothes!).

reviews.title: Fabulous weekend getaway at Grotto Bay
Can't Wait to Return to Grotto Bay
reviews.text: My husband and I spent our honeymoon 10 years ago at another Bermuda hotel, and were disappointed when we couldn't afford to return there for our 10th anniversary. We booked a week at Grotto Bay instead, and then I read some of the negative reviews; I was frightened. However, I shouldn't have been. Our stay at Grotto Bay was terrific!

We stayed in a first-floor room on the upper level--the cheapest kind available. Our room was attractive, and the view was excellent! There were some minor irritations--dresser drawers that were difficult to open, for example, and a second key that wouldn't actually open the door--but nothing serious, and definitely NO BUGS. (I was, however, completely charmed by the tiny tree frogs that occasionally hung around outside our room in the evening.) The staff was friendly and helpful as well, and they tried to remedy the few problems we had. (They recut the second key three different times, but it never did fit.)
reviews.title: Grotto Bay great deal for short get away
Roach Motel - SaveYour Money
reviews.text: The hotel lobby and grounds are gorgeous. The beach is small, but it was never crowded, and there are plenty of lounge chairs for all. And the bay is a great place to kayak! The hotel's location is a good distance from Hamilton and the South Shore beaches, but it's very close to St. George's, and the buses to other locations are clean, reliable, and comfortable. Also, if you're traveling all the way to Hamilton or the Dockyard, try the ferry--it's clean, fast, and fun, with great views.

We were on the all-inclusive plan, which made budgeting easier. The food was excellent, even if the menu was somewhat limited. (The pan-fried fish sandwich on the lunch menu is surprisingly good!) Service was a bit slow, but everyone was friendly; in fact, the employees frequently took time out to chat with us. (And since we were on the all-inclusive plan, it WASN'T to increase their tips!)
reviews.title: loved Grotto Bay!

reviews.text: In general, this was one of the most relaxing vacations I've ever had. The atmosphere is comfortable and homey, the views are amazing, the people were friendly...We're already planning a return trip to Grotto Bay!
reviews.title: very nice weekend getaway

reviews.text: First off this was a packaged deal via Bermuda Tourism.....a bargain that was done in conjunction with Expedia but cheaper than booking via Expedia.

reviews.title: Loved the caves
reviews.text: Place is short hop from airport. Take a cab ....it's about $7-8 including tips. Take the bus if you have a bag that will fit in your lap.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is average in sense of the room and the dining is above average. They have an afternoon tea and on Monday a manger's party that includes unlimited rum swizzles. The Hotel is right on the bus line which gives you easy access to either St. George or Hamiton. A bus pass is available but only if you are going to make several stops. Down the street about a 100 yards in a gas station that has snacks for those on a limited budget. If you tour you can always pick up some treats since the room has a fridge. The hotel has a meal plan that is pricey but in reality worth it if you are a hearty eater and not on a real budget. This hotel is also kid friendly and seemed to have a lot of scheduled activities. Also, up the street is the Swizzle Inn that has traditional pub fare for about $13-20 per person.
reviews.title: Had a wonderful time at Grotto Bay
Grotto Bay was a beautiful resort!
reviews.text: If you go to St. George in off season - November through early April - check on historical sites before you go. We did not and found everything we wanted to see closed depite the fact they were listed as "opened." We also found the Crystal Caves a waste of money. The tour lasts about 15 minutes and the caves are ho hum unless it is the first time you have seen one. At $16 it is not worth it. That was the only attraction that we would give a thumbs down to. Otherwise, be prepared to spend...the only places I have found more expensive then Bermuda are Iceland and Japan.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a 4 day trip to Grotto Bay. I thought the caves were unbelievable and wondered why more photos were not available. Then I processed my film and, My pictures were awful. The flash on the camera is just not enough to take in the beauty. GO and see. The rooms are a bit small but clean and up to date. The restautant was good but VERY expensive. Take a left at the road outside the entrance and you will see a Shell station. Hot soup, Sandwiches, Dinners (small) but good and home made pastries every day. The staff is friendly and the grounds are well maintained. I would recommend this place to a friend. If you have any health problems or find it hard to walk steep hills then find somewhere else as there are no handicapped facilities.Nancy from N.C.
reviews.title: A Slice of Bermudian Heaven

reviews.text: Absolutely loved this place! My boyfriend and I loved the proximity to the airport and could not hear any planes at all. Our room was very clean and had a view of the bay and the nice blue ocean. And yes there were lots of stairs but there was always people willing to help with our luggage. The caves were great -go swimming in it and then quickly jump into the jacuzzi bacause the water was cold! The beach was small but adequate. The snorkeling was just okay there. I don't know if it's always like this or just our bad luck but the water was somewhat murky. So we just took the mini-bus to Tobacco Bay and the waters there were much more clear! Just watch out for the cruise ship crowds!
reviews.title: Fantastic vacation!

reviews.text: The only real negative aspect was the price of the food for the quality. We ate at the hotel once and decided never again! Walk down to the Swizzle Inn or Bailey's or better yet, do what we did - we stockpiled our mini-fridge with groceries we had lugged from the states. We were able to pack lunches and eat them wherever we were.
reviews.title: Wonderful Way to Spend A Birthday
Very Good
reviews.text: I would defintely go back. The hotel was beautiful, as was the island. Next time we will work up the courage to rent a scooter bike so we could see the rest of this island!

I just returned from a nine day trip to Bermuda and the Grotto Bay Resort. Went there for my 40th birthday along with family and friends - 14 in all. We had a oceanfront room on the first floor, room 116 to be exact, it was lovely. Nothing better than waking up in the morning to sun and a wonderful view of the bay, and the beautiful blue water of Bermuda. We all had the all-inclusive plan, which by the way I felt was definitely worth doing, all your meals (breakfast, lunch, afternoon tea, dinner), all drinks (alcohol, water and soda) and all non-motorized sports (kayaks, rafts, snorkeling equipment, sailboat, wind-surfing) included. Along with a free bus and ferry pass for your entire stay. They had entertainment every night, along with a very friendly staff, especially Lauretta, and June - the concierges, and Susan, Omar, and Heidi, in the restaurant. My dad has some trouble walking distances and they had a van that took him from the main building to right in front of his room and from his room down to the pool at his request. I would highly suggest going to the Grotto Bay and especially Bermuda can’t wait until I can go back again.
reviews.title: Overall good hotel, but with a little work it could be great

reviews.text: We spent 4 nights there in mid June. After reading some other reviews, I was a bit worried. Overall we really liked the place. The rooms were nice, clean, and well serviced. The rooms include free wall safes and refrigerators. Also cable TV. There were plenty of planned daily activities for adults and children. The pool is open 24/7. They could use some beach and pool umbrellas. The hotel desk staff was a little on the slow side at times. The location is very convenient to the airport and St George. Bus service is frequent and you can get tokens at the front desk. I peeked at the gym and it was pretty tiny. They are planning on making a new fitness center. We only had lunch at the hotel (by the pool). It was typical fair. They need to add a second bartender at the pool bar--he is too busy byu himself. There were plent of pool and room towels (both fluffy and big). They usually had some type of evening entertainment. The pool bar wasn't always open at night. Definately check out Prospero's caves (right near the pool). They are free (as opposed tot he crystal caves off site and are very cool. The doormen will bring your bags to your room. It is on a hill and so trips from the pool to the top level can be a little bit of a hike but we only would need to do it once or twice a day. The best beach we found was Horseshoe bay. You need to switch buses to get there from Grotto. If you use a token (14 zone) to Hamilton, you can get a free transfer. If you take the bus to Horseshoe, on the way back (bus #7) you can switch to one of the ST George buses en route instead of going to Hamilton and getting the bus there. This is beacuse the routes overlap. Ask the busdriver where to get off early. They are also very friendly. We would go back to Grotto although I would also consider something near Elbow beach since those beaches are so nice.
reviews.title: Great stay at Grotto Bay

reviews.text: We just had a week long vacation at Grotto Bay. Although the view from the beach wasn't the greatest Bermuda could offer, we really enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: Great Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are make-your-own-adventure travelers who were not looking for anything spectacular in a Bermuda hotel. We picked Grotto Bay because we got a great deal and it seemed nice enough to meet our not-high expectations. It wasn't. I'm not quite sure how this place gets even decent ratings on TripAdvisor. Is it the bugs all over the filthy resort bar that was just randomly closed one day? or the run-down rooms with no deadlocks? or the north-facing beach? or the totally rude front desk staff who were expert at making you feel like you were putting them out by making even the smallest request (e.g. "you can check out at noon but you better not spend one minute longer in your room")? or was it the dirt covered room floors (we spilled some apple juice on the floor and the towel we used to wipe it up was black from the dirt)? or perhaps the safe that didn't have a key that they were "working on" getting? or the shower that opened into the bathroom drenching it with water (unlike bathrooms like this in Europe, these didn't have a drain, so the water just sat there)? or the broken glass in and around the beach shower? or the overgrown path that was almost impossible to navigate down to the water? or the bed's blanket that was covered in (presumably bodily fluid) stains? or the towels that were so old that they all had frayed edges? or the torturously uncomfortable old mattresses? or the TV that defaulted to a volume of full blast whenever it was turned back on? We spent five nights at Grotto Bay, and would have been much better off spending the same amount of money to stay somewhere else for a shorter period of time. We were certainly not expecting a five-star hotel, but I've stayed in two-star and one-star hotels in many, many places and they were all better than Grotto Bay. If you are the type of traveler that feels uncomfortable in a clean, nice place, Grotto Bay might be for you. Otherwise, my advice would be to look elsewhere.
reviews.title: Easy-going travelers not easy-going enough for Grotto Bay

likes.liked: — Close to the bus so that we could get away from it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from Grotto Bay and had a wonderful time. We had an oceanview room which offered a fine view of the bay.. The place was very quiet in general... The grounds are very nice but are extremely steep... Our room smelled like a dirty drunken sailer when we first got there,.. but were able to correct it with candles... Room size was fine... big king-size, refrigerator. We liked the caves on the property... very interesting... breakfast buffet was good but some items were cold. Weather was constantly changing but overall was very good, over 75 degrees.. Went to Horshshoe Bay one day and had a great day full of sunshine.... Bus is convenient, but a tad far away and gets to be a drag by day 3... Will definately be going back to Bermuda... Will probably try another hotel.
reviews.title: Grotto Bay in November
